name: Terran Nights
description: The glint of duranium as it zips through space. The solar winds in your nacelles. The warbird burning trailing dilithium and chronitons long before its time might be out for more than a joyride!
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Raffi, Bashir, J. Archer, 2024 Picard, Displaced crew or crew with matching Battle Traits, will provide a bonus.
-- Using the Romulan Bird-of-Prey, La Sirena, or the Breen Warship will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Raffi, Bashir, J. Archer, 2024 Picard, or Displaced

featured_crew.name: Dr. Taylor
featured_crew.flavor: Beamed down the rabbit hole, Gillian Taylor is amazed by the transporter technology from the future.

featured_crew.name: Raffi
featured_crew.flavor: Together with Seven and Rios, Raffi was sent back to 2024 Los Angeles to find the mysterious Watcher, the key to fixing the future.

action.name: I'm a Doctor, Not a Historian

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

action.name: I'm a Doctor, Not a Historian

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Dr. Taylor
rewards.flavor: Beamed down the rabbit hole, Gillian Taylor is amazed by the transporter technology from the future.

action.name: I'm a Doctor, Not a Historian

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "We've been keeping a safe distance from Earth to observe without detection by scientists or satellites, but we've become aware of another ship that lacks such discretion."

"I wouldn't even say a lack of discretion; this ship's racing toward Earth at full speed. We can't even get a reading on it, but it's headed your way, Captain. How about helping them pump the breaks before someone gets hurt?"
"We've been keeping a safe distance from Earth to observe without detection by scientists or satellites, but we've become aware of another ship that lacks such discretion."

"I wouldn't even say a lack of discretion; this ship's racing toward Earth at full speed. We can't even get a reading on it, but it's headed your way, Captain. How about helping them pump the breaks before someone gets hurt?"
"As much as I hate to admit it, that sure was a rush, huh, Captain? I don't care what anyone from this century says, piloting a starship will always be far more fun than driving a car."

responses.text: "An automobile from past centuries and a starcraft are hardly comparable."
"Care to see who's the better driver here?"

screens.text: "Driving a car is a far more pleasurable experience when you can do it with some degree of competence. Honestly, to think they allow fools like you to steer the fates of hundreds or thousands when you can't even make sense of a gear shift."
"And yet I so quickly adapted from automobiles to spacecraft when awakening in the 23rd century. Is a matter of comparability or simply the quality of who is at the helm?"
"Anytime, Captain. It would be my pleasure to elucidate the vast difference in skill between the two of us."
"Yes, how about that Bird-of-Prey? We still have no idea why they were heading to Earth in such a hurry."

"Enough chatter then. The Bird-of-Prey has its sights set on Earth once more. If you are so committed to its protection, I suggest you put a stop to it once and for all. And give us a good show while you're at it, Captain."
"As much as I hate to admit it, that sure was a rush, huh, Captain? I don't care what anyone from this century says, piloting a starship will always be far more fun than driving a car."

responses.text: "An automobile from past centuries and a starcraft are hardly comparable."
"Care to see who's the better driver here?"

screens.text: "Driving a car is a far more pleasurable experience when you can do it with some degree of competence. Honestly, to think they allow fools like you to steer the fates of hundreds or thousands when you can't even make sense of a gear shift."
"And yet I so quickly adapted from automobiles to spacecraft when awakening in the 23rd century. Is a matter of comparability or simply the quality of who is at the helm?"
"Anytime, Captain. It would be my pleasure to elucidate the vast difference in skill between the two of us."
"Yes, how about that Bird-of-Prey? We still have no idea why they were heading to Earth in such a hurry."

"Enough chatter then. The Bird-of-Prey has its sights set on Earth once more. If you are so committed to its protection, I suggest you put a stop to it once and for all. And give us a good show while you're at it, Captain."
